channel.title: JMenu position
channel.description:
[img]http://i135.photobucket.com/albums/q147/eczema3/JMenu.jpg[/img]
Another question, how could I move both the buttons that are on the right to underneath the textfield ?

item.title: JMenu position
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:22, topic:198112”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=262695.msg2188369#msg2188369 date=1208252999]

Read this first:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/layout/using.html

And:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/layout/visual.html

Then read:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/awt/BorderLayout.html

wow, im suprised you posted this.
rep+ useful + RELEVANT, soon you will be promoted and have moparscape tag removed.

Leave TeleNubby alone, he hasn’t done anything to you, rather he’s done more than you.
[/quote]
what are you talking about… i was complimenting the guy.[/quote]You’re oh so funny.

item.title: JMenu position
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Ah, late response. This topic slipped my mind. Whatever. Anyways…

[quote=“Ollie, post:11, topic:198112”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=262695.msg2177831#msg2177831 date=1207884210]
Read this first:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/layout/using.html

And:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/layout/visual.html

Then read:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/awt/BorderLayout.html
[/quote]

wow, im suprised you posted this.
rep+ useful + RELEVANT, soon you will be promoted and have moparscape tag removed.[/quote]
You actually repped me. Wow. Also, he asked if there was a way to keep his two JButtons under his JTextField. Eventually it’ll happen so that he’ll want to resize, etc., and using setBounds() or anything similar to move his components will get lets say ‘tough’. Using a LayoutManager can keep it nice and clean and it DOES place his two buttons under his text field.

Read full topic

item.title: JMenu position
item.dc:creator: @_Java_Maybe • Java Maybe •
item.description:
@_Java_Maybe wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:5, topic:198112”]Use:
frame.setJMenuBar(menuBar);

frame = the name of your jframe
menuBar = the name of your menubar[/quote]

Old classic way, like it also!

@Tico135 wrote:

Use:
frame.setJMenuBar(menuBar);

frame = the name of your jframe
menuBar = the name of your menubar

item.title: JMenu position
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

don’t add it like any other component, JFrame has a special method for JMenuBar, JFrame.setJMenuBar(JMenuBar);
